result.execSummary:
The defendant Mark S Shallow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark S Shallow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Mark S Shallow was found guilty of Carry Handgun-Alcohol Sold/Consumed, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.237(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Warrant canceled andfaxed to Sheriff's Department, Commitment paid in full.
Request for payment of $51 witness fees for witness Ronald G. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x25478201 in court 3x on 10/14/15, 11/23/15, 9/14/15.
F&C Commitment isued for failure to pay.  15 days HOC.  Due & owing
WICS printout/screenshot
Witness fee request prepared for Ronald G. was approved for 3 appearances on 10/14/15, 11/23/15, 9/14/15 by the DAs Victim/Witness Services.
Witness fee request received from DA's Victim/Witness Services was returned to DA's Victim/Witness Services for specific approved appearance dates for Ronald G.
Witness fee request prepared for Ronald G. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Due to not following the payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended and the failure to pay action has been enforced.
See case no. 15cm116 for Witness fee request prepared for Tabatha L., Jeffrey F. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval and date confirmation.
Assessment for Attorney Fees in the amount of $912.50 entered as ordered by the court on 02/12/16 to pay $50.00 monthly.  Final payment due by 09/01/17. Failure to pay is a Civil Judgment.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

Sentencing proceeded as to Count TWO: 

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve  30 days  in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 3 days time served. No  Huber privileges . Court stayed the commencment until 12-31-15. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory  court costs , fees  and surcharges by 6-27-16  or, if not paid, serve 15  days in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence. 

 Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT TWO: 

Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. 

On motion of the State, Court ordered Count ONE:  Dismissed. 

Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
STate filed amended witness list.
State filed witness list; proposed jury and motion in limine.
Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case remains on for jury trial.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for final pretrial on 10-13-15 at 1:30 and   jury trial in Branch 47 lr  Jury trial scheduled for 11-23-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 47. lr  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-16-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Status Conference. State requests an ajourned Status Conference. Court granted request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Status conference scheduled for June 5, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 05-05-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  
  Indigency hearing proceeded.   Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Christopher Ertl as counsel for defendant.   Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County . Court appoints at the rate of $50.00 per hour.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 03-31-2015 at 08:30 am.
The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 02-06-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Mark S Shallow in court.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
PER ADA CAROLE MANCHESTER, THIS CASE IS TO BE ASSIGNED TO JUDGE SIEFERT.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.47.vb
